001package io.cyborgcode.roa.api.authentication;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.log.LogApi;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.api.service.RestService;
005import io.restassured.http.Header;
006import java.util.Map;
007import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
008import lombok.NonNull;
009
010/**
011 * Abstract base class for authentication clients.
012 *
013 * <p>Provides a caching mechanism for authentication headers and defines
014 * a template method for implementing authentication logic.
015 *
016 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
017 */
018public abstract class BaseAuthenticationClient implements AuthenticationClient {
019
020   /**
021    * Stores authentication headers mapped by their corresponding authentication keys.
022    */
023   protected static final Map<AuthenticationKey, Header> userAuthenticationHeaderMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
024
025   /**
026    * Authenticates a user and caches the authentication header if caching is enabled.
027    *
028    * @param restService The {@code RestService} instance handling the authentication request.
029    * @param username    The username for authentication.
030    * @param password    The password for authentication.
031    * @param cache       Whether to cache the authentication header.
032    * @return The generated {@code AuthenticationKey}.
033    */
034   @Override
035   public AuthenticationKey authenticate(final @NonNull RestService restService,
036                                         @NonNull final String username,
037                                         final String password,
038                                         boolean cache) {
039      AuthenticationKey authenticationKey = new AuthenticationKey(username, password, this.getClass());
040
041      if (!cache) {
042         Header header = authenticateImpl(restService, username, password);
043         userAuthenticationHeaderMap.put(authenticationKey, header);
044         LogApi.info("Successfully authenticated user: {}", username);
045      } else {
046         userAuthenticationHeaderMap.computeIfAbsent(authenticationKey, key -> {
047            Header header = authenticateImpl(restService, username, password);
048            LogApi.info("Successfully authenticated user: {}", username);
049            return header;
050         });
051      }
052      return authenticationKey;
053   }
054
055   /**
056    * Retrieves the authentication header associated with the given authentication key.
057    *
058    * @param authenticationKey The authentication key identifying the session.
059    * @return The corresponding authentication header, or {@code null} if not found.
060    */
061   public Header getAuthentication(final AuthenticationKey authenticationKey) {
062      if (authenticationKey == null) {
063         LogApi.error("AuthenticationKey is null. Cannot retrieve authentication header.");
064         throw new IllegalArgumentException("AuthenticationKey cannot be null.");
065      }
066      return userAuthenticationHeaderMap.get(authenticationKey);
067   }
068
069   /**
070    * Performs the actual authentication process and returns the authentication header.
071    *
072    * @param restService The {@code RestService} instance handling the request.
073    * @param username    The username for authentication.
074    * @param password    The password for authentication.
075    * @return The authentication header containing credentials.
076    */
077   protected abstract Header authenticateImpl(RestService restService, String username, String password);
078}
